image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

title.children: Family's anger at seven-year coronial inquest wait

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is majority-owned by Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

title.children: Who is really pulling the strings at Optus?

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: A childcare centre in Adelaide's inner south-west has been ordered to close for two weeks after being handed an emergency action notice following claims children were left unsupervised.

title.children: Childcare centre temporarily shut amid claims children were left unsupervised

image.altText: Mohammad Shareed Hotak - man with dark hair in green shirt

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has ordered Uber to repay lost wages to a driver it deemed was unfairly deactivated from the rideshare platform.

title.children: Uber ordered to pay lost wages in 'landmark' unfair deactivation case

image.altText: blue Optus signage outside an office on Lyonmark Road

props.synopsis: In enforcing the fine today, the Federal Court's Justice Patrick O'Sullivan described the company's conduct as "extremely serious" and "appalling".

title.children: Optus to pay $100m fine, as crisis engulfing the telco continues

image.altText: Murray Watt presser

props.synopsis: Officials from the federal environment department say they were not aware of the impact of SA's algal bloom until the state government contacted them in May, two months after the bloom was first detected.

title.children: 'We were not aware': Federal-state algal bloom communications under fire

image.altText: A Flinders University sign on a glass wall.

props.synopsis: Six internationally recognised marine scientists who are researching South Australia's toxic algal bloom are set to lose their jobs at Flinders University, the ABC understands.

title.children: Flinders University jobs under threat as news of proposed restructure spreads

image.altText: Black and white photo of two people smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian kitchen manufacturer says a scammer has tried to extort money to remove several fake one-star reviews posted to Google.

title.children: SA business asked to pay $US200 to remove fake one-star Google reviews

image.altText: A UTS building in the background with torn pieces of paper scattered over the top with words from reports written on them

props.synopsis: The National Student Ombudsman is investigating allegations UTS failed to improve its response to sexual harm and gender-based violence despite four reviews since 2022.

title.children: UTS students say they regret reporting sexual harassment as ombudsman investigates

image.altText: A red and white sign which reads MS with South Australia & Northern Territory underneath in black letters

props.synopsis: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.

title.children: Non-profit multiple sclerosis support agency in voluntary administration

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

title.children: China's lead over the US in South-East Asia is likely to grow

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel standing on a red carpet looking at the camera and smiling.

props.synopsis: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

title.children: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views, Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'

image.altText: Madleen sets sail

props.synopsis: The flotilla carrying aid and pro-Palestinian activists said they heard explosions and saw multiple drones that targeted some of their boats.

title.children: Italy deploys navy ship to help Gaza aid flotilla after drone attack

image.altText: A pregnant woman touching her tummy.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's latest health advice goes against the evidence, stigmatises autism and unfairly blames women.

title.children: Trump's 'tough it out' advice to pregnant women is dangerous

image.altText: A man wearing a suit scrunches his eyebrows as he looks sideways with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president described Sadiq Khan as "terrible" and warned the British capital was heading towards "sharia law".

title.children: London mayor calls Trump racist, sexist and Islamophobic

image.altText: A woman holding a flower in bushland

props.synopsis: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

title.children: Tired of police ‘excuses’: Family of missing people demand change

image.altText: A man looks at his watch as fluid runs down a tube into his belly.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

title.children: Lives ruined and tears shed from Australians injured by COVID vaccines

image.altText: An elderly woman with a trolley seen from behind looking at the meat section of a supermarket.

props.synopsis: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

title.children: Why are grocery prices still going up, despite government pressure?

image.altText: A motorcycle on its side with a crashed car.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 17 people in Taiwan and is expected to head towards the south Chinese coast.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa heads for south China, as 2 million evacuated

image.altText: Weona Park Stud

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian horse breeder has been told to reduce the number of horses on her property and rehome them, after concerns were raised by members of the racing community.

title.children: Horse breeder feels 'harassed' after social media storm leads to inspection

image.altText: A fire ant nest

props.synopsis: Authorities launch an independent review of Australia’s national fire ant eradication program to evaluate the country’s fight against one of the world’s most destructive pests.

title.children: Review launched into fire ant eradication effort

image.altText: errol musk an older man looks out from behind a pane of glass

props.synopsis: Multiple police reports, social workers and family members uncover the allegations against 79-year-old Errol Musk.

title.children: The background on child abuse allegations tearing the Musk family apart

image.altText: Park with kids and parents gathered in background, empty pram in foreground

props.synopsis: A federal government backed weekly reading session led by experts is helping improve literacy rates in Queensland children.

title.children: How reading in the park is turning poor literacy rates around for kids

image.altText: Bright yellow canola flowers in a paddock fill the frame.

props.synopsis: Selfie hunters seeking the perfect social media photo among flowering canola are putting their safety and growers' livelihoods at risk, farmers say.

title.children: Farmers notice more canola crop trespassers wandering into paddocks

image.altText: Female surgeon looks at screen with MRI scan with brain Images

props.synopsis: The Therapeutic Goods Administration approves the drug Lecanemab, which can slow down cognitive decline in the early stages of Alzheimer's.

title.children: Promising Alzheimer's drug gets green light from Australian regulators

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf in a black silk dress, on a CBD street, with four people walking behind here.

props.synopsis: The judge ordered ABC to pay a fine of $150,000 for unlawfully sacking journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf for reasons including her political opinions.

title.children: Judge says ABC 'let down the Australian public' over Lattouf sacking

image.altText: A close up of a stern Donald and slightly smiling Melania Trump while standing on an escalator.

props.synopsis: Footage of the US president and his wife's reactions to the mishap was shared widely on social media.

title.children: UN says Trump videographer likely triggered viral escalator moment

image.altText: Bruce walks outside, flanked by others, wearing a blue suit, white shirt and pink tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann launches Federal Court action seeking funding for legal representation at a National Anti-Corruption Commission hearing after raids on his home in June last year.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann seeks funds for legal representation over 2024 raids

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference

props.synopsis: Western Australia's GST deal, expected to cost the Commonwealth $60 billion by 2029, will form part of a review by the Australian Productivity Commission.

title.children: Review to assess whether WA's $60 billion GST slice is fair

image.altText: A composite image of Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus arriving at court

props.synopsis: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

title.children: Former A-League footballers sentenced over betting scam

image.altText: A bald man with 'Too good too slow too old go cat 2022 premeriship' tattooed on his head wearing a signed Geelong jersey

props.synopsis: From a unique tattoo to a personalised burger, the AFL grand final is more than just a game for these super fans.

title.children: Geelong's most committed fan hopes to add to premiership tribute

image.altText: A display for a soldier in a war memorial.

props.synopsis: The war memorial's revised display now mentions Ben Roberts-Smith's failed bid to the High Court.

title.children: Australian War Memorial updates Ben Roberts-Smith display a third time

image.altText: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr speaking at a podium with President Donald Trump standing behind him.

props.synopsis: The US government has announced a drug named leucovorin will be approved to treat symptoms of autism in some children. So what is the drug, and is there any evidence to support its use?

title.children: What is leucovorin, the drug Trump claims can help treat autism?

image.altText: matt dun with his daughter josephine, with her wearing a bow in her hair smiling at camera and wearing a football jersey

props.synopsis: A professor who lost his daughter to brain cancer in 2018 is hopeful the research to find a cure in children is just five years away from clinical trials.

title.children: Doctor who lost daughter to brain cancer hopeful for cure after $18m grant

image.altText: A 23-year-old man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: An Australian family is asking why Indonesian police allowed three Australian witnesses to return home without being interviewed after their 23-year-old son died on the Indonesian holiday resort island.

title.children: Australian family suspects foul play in son's death in Bali villa pool
